channel.title: Our World in Data - Data Insights
channel.description: Data Insights from Our World in Data

item.title: Japan’s cherry trees have been blossoming earlier due to warmer spring temperatures
item.description: The peak flowering of cherry trees in Kyoto, Japan, has been recorded since the ninth century. Yasuyuki Aono and colleagues from the Osaka Prefecture University collated this data from historical diaries and chronicles, indicating the dates on which cherry blossom viewing parties had been held or other observations of peak blossom. (…) https://ourworldindata.org/data-insight/japans-cherry-trees-have-been-blossoming-earlier-due-to-warmer-spring-temperatures

item.title: Declining child mortality, fast and slow
item.description: Two centuries ago, about one in three children in Sweden died before they were five years old, as you can see on the chart. (…) https://ourworldindata.org/data-insight/declining-child-mortality-fast-and-slow

item.title: A record number of objects went into space in 2023
item.description: 2,664 objects were launched into space in 2023. This figure breaks the record set the previous year. (…) https://ourworldindata.org/data-insight/a-record-number-of-objects-went-into-space-in-2023

item.title: Indonesia’s shift to cleaner cooking fuels has greatly improved air quality and health
item.description: In 2000, less than 10% of the population in Indonesia had access to clean cooking fuels. This is now over 80%, as the chart shows. (…) https://ourworldindata.org/data-insight/indonesias-shift-to-cleaner-cooking-fuels-has-greatly-improved-air-quality-and-health

item.title: Extreme poverty in China has been almost eliminated — first in urban, then in rural regions
item.description: In 1981, 97% of people in the Chinese countryside lived in extreme poverty. Even in cities, it was more than 70%. (…) https://ourworldindata.org/data-insight/extreme-poverty-in-china-has-been-almost-eliminated-first-in-urban-then-in-rural-regions

item.title: Solar and wind gain an edge over coal in a number of countries
item.description: Solar and wind have surpassed coal as a source of electricity generation in a number of countries, as the chart shows. This marks a substantial shift towards more sustainable sources of energy. (…) https://ourworldindata.org/data-insight/solar-and-wind-gain-an-edge-over-coal-in-a-number-of-countries

item.title: Differences in life expectancy across the world are extremely large
item.description: People in richer countries tend to live much longer than those in poorer countries. (…) https://ourworldindata.org/data-insight/differences-in-life-expectancy-across-the-world-are-extremely-large

item.title: Pacemakers are crucial to people with heart rhythm disorders, but their adoption varies widely
item.description: Pacemakers are crucial medical devices for people with heart disorders and irregular heartbeats. They provide a steady heart rhythm and help the heart pump blood effectively to the rest of the body. (…) https://ourworldindata.org/data-insight/pacemakers-are-crucial-to-people-with-heart-rhythm-disorders-but-their-adoption-varies-widely
